comments:
Build: I20070501-0010

1) Open Help > About Eclipse
2) Click "Feature Details"
3) Select a feature and click "License"

-> Nothing happens. There is an error in my log.  From the log, it appears it is looking in the wrong place for my browser. I used to have Firefox installed there, but don't any longer.  I have updated the location info on the "Browser" preference page, but it still doesn't work.  I am able to open a browser widget elsewhere in Eclipse (in place HTML viewer, help)

java.io.IOException: CreateProcess: C:\Program Files\Mozilla Firefox\firefox.exe file:/C:/1target/extra-plugins/eclipse/features/org.eclipse.releng.tools_3.2.100.v20070122-32-7w31181523/license.html error=2
	at java.lang.ProcessImpl.create(Native Method)
	at java.lang.ProcessImpl.<init>(ProcessImpl.java:108)
	at java.lang.ProcessImpl.start(ProcessImpl.java:56)
	at java.lang.ProcessBuilder.start(ProcessBuilder.java:466)
	at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:607)
	at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:445)
	at java.lang.Runtime.exec(Runtime.java:342)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.browsers.MozillaBrowser$BrowserThread.openBrowser(MozillaBrowser.java:75)
	at org.eclipse.ui.internal.browser.browsers.MozillaBrowser$BrowserThread.run(MozillaBrowser.java:146)
The dialog is trying to open an external browser using the browser support rather than an internal.  Passing to UA for comment.
Not sure why you are seeing this problem - for me it works fine.
I don't know what has changed in the past couple of weeks, but this works for me using I20070523-0010.
